message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique and valuable product. I believe it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to make a generous offer. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $1200000. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I'm willing to pay that price for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

Thanks for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $1000000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this sale. What do you think?
I understand you're looking to make a profit, but $950000 is my maximum offer. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I'm not willing to go any higher than that. Is there any flexibility on your end?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $1050000. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers, so I'll throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. What do you think?

I appreciate the extras, but I'm still not willing to pay $1050000. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers, like you suggested, so I'll make a new offer of $975000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still not willing to go below $1100000. I think we're getting close to a fair price, but I need to make sure I'm getting the value I deserve for this product. I'm willing to throw in some additional perks to sweeten the deal, but I need to see a bit more movement from you. What do you think?
